children.title: angels
children.comment: Spiritual beings who assist God, especially in his work of salvation, conveying his word to human beings and attending to the needs of God's people.

children.title: angels, as God's servants
children.comment: Angels have specific yet limited roles to play in declaring God's will and purposes for humanity.

children.title: Angels as agents of God's salvation
Angels do not fully understand God's salvation
Angels deliver God's people from their enemies

primaryrefs.comment: The law was mediated by angels to Moses and Israel

children.title: Angels as revealers of God's will
Angels convey and fulfil God's instructions
Angels attend to the needs of God's people
Angels provide food at special times
Angels care for Jesus Christ's needs
Angels are ready to protect Jesus Christ
Angels are inferior to Jesus Christ
angels, as God's messengers
children.comment: Spiritual messengers with the special role of making known God's work of salvation.

children.title: Angels give hope through the words of the prophets

primaryrefs.comment: The voice in this passage may be that of an angel.

children.title: Angels and the coming of the Messiah
An angel foretells the birth of John the Baptist
Angels foretell Jesus Christ's second coming
Angels reveal the gospel for the Gentiles
angels, as agents of God's judgment
children.comment: Spiritual beings who assist God in carrying out his judgments. Angels will be especially active when Jesus Christ returns for the last judgment.

children.title: Angels as agents of earthly judgments
Angels hold back the final judgment
Angels carry out preliminary warning judgments
Angels accompany Jesus Christ when he returns to judge
Angels gather everyone for the final judgment
angels, and praise of God
children.comment: Spiritual beings who praise God in a manner that is beyond human capacity.

children.title: Angels worship God in his presence
Angels praise God for his works
Angels praise God's work of creation
Angels praise God's work of redemption

primaryrefs.comment: The angels are praising God for Jesus Christ's birth.

children.title: Images of angelic beings decorate Israel's sanctuaries

seealsos.comment: The images of the cherubim represent the angels who worship God in heaven.

children.title: Angels are not to be worshipped
angels, opposed to God
children.comment: Spiritual beings who fell with Satan. They are under God's judgment and are subject to the authority of believers.

children.title: Angels opposed to God will be judged
Jesus Christ has defeated Satan and his angels
Satan's angels are resisted by God's faithful angels

seealsos.comment: The princes of Persia and Greece appear to be spiritual powers who resist God's rule over these regions.

children.title: Jesus Christ gives authority over Satan and his angels to believers

children.title: Jesus Christ gives authority over Satan and his angels to believers
Satan
children.comment: The one who opposes the person and purposes of God. Satan is especially associated with deceit, temptation and testing, through which he attempts to deflect believers from obeying God.

children.title: Satan, as the enemy of God
children.comment: Scripture provides numerous examples of ways in which Satan opposes the presence and purposes of God in his world.

children.title: Satan tests believers and causes their suffering
Satan opposes the work of the archangel Michael

seealsos.comment: the parable of the weeds and its explanation
Elymas, the sorcerer, acts on Satan's behalf to oppose Barnabas and Paul.

children.title: Satan's opposition to God's work will not succeed
Satan's role as adversary earns him varied titles
The devil
children.precomment: He is the adversary because he deceives:

children.title: Belial
children.precomment: He is the adversary because he is the troublemaker or scoundrel (the same Hebrew word is used in the OT passages as in 2Co 6:15 to describe Satan's work):

children.title: The dragon
children.precomment: He is the adversary because he is the enemy:

children.title: The serpent
children.precomment: He is the adversary because he thwarts spiritual insight:

children.title: The prince of this world
children.precomment: He is the adversary because his rule is temporary, not absolute:

secondaryrefs.comment: He is the adversary because he is the destroyer.

children.title: Satan, as tempter
children.comment: God's people are incited to evil by Satan. He seeks to exploit their weaknesses in order to deflect them from obedience to God.

children.title: Satan incites God's people to evil

primaryrefs.comment: Rev 12:9 identifies the serpent with Satan.

children.title: He tempts Christians to fall away
He inspires people to put God to the test
Jesus Christ is tempted by Satan
By Jesus Christ's service as high priest
Satan, as deceiver
children.comment: Satan's character is deceitful, devious and cunning as in a variety of guises he seeks to influence people for his own ends.

primaryrefs.comment: Eve was deceived by Satan the serpent.

children.title: Satan, kingdom of
children.comment: Satan is depicted as the prince of this world, having power over demons and over godless people. He is, however, subject to God's sovereignty and therefore his power is limited and his rule temporary.

children.title: He has power in the world
He claims power over this world
He is called the ``prince'' or the ``god'' of this world
He is responsible for some illnesses

seealsos.comment: Paul's ``thorn in the flesh'' may or may not have been a physical illness.

children.title: He is the prince of demons

primaryrefs.comment: The name Beelzebub is used elsewhere to name the prince of the demons. This name was used also to identify Satan.

children.title: He cannot do more than God allows
Satan, agents of
children.comment: Satan works in this world through people and through those spiritual beings who acknowledge his authority. His agents oppose God's will and purposes.

children.title: Satan's human agents pursue his evil desires

primaryrefs.comment: Jesus Christ speaking of the relationship of some unbelieving Jews to Satan.

children.title: Satan works through people to oppose God's purposes
Examples of people doing Satan's work
Others who lead people away from God
Satan works through his spiritual agents

seealsos.comment: ``angel'' and ``messenger'' are the same word in Greek

children.title: Satan's agents are identified by various images and titles

secondaryrefs.comment: probably representing a demon with influence over the Persian kingdom

children.title: The prostitute or Babylon the Great
Satan, resistance to
children.comment: Jesus Christ resisted Satan in his ministry, and believers are commanded to follow his example in this respect. God assists believers in this struggle.

children.title: God protects his people from Satan
God's protection is to be sought in prayer
Jesus Christ has the victory over Satan
Jesus Christ's defeat of Satan on the cross
Jesus Christ's name is powerful against Satan
Satan, defeat of
children.comment: Though defeated on Jesus Christ's cross, Satan is still active in this world, but his final overthrow by God is certain.

children.title: Satan is defeated by Jesus Christ
Jesus Christ is stronger than Satan
Jesus Christ came to destroy Satan's work
Satan is defeated on the cross
Satan's defeat is foreseen by Jesus Christ
Satan and his agents will be destroyed
Death, the result of Satan's work, will be defeated

demons
children.comment: Evil spiritual forces; Scripture stresses the reality of demonic forces and recognises a number of categories to which they may be assigned. Jesus Christ's authority over such demonic forces is seen at work in his ministry and in that of his disciples.

children.title: demons, kinds of
children.comment: Scripture uses a number of terms to refer to demonic forces, stressing both their reality and hostility to God.

children.title: demons, malevolence of
children.comment: Demons are opposed to the person and work of God and seek to lead human beings, including believers, away from him. For this reason, believers are forbidden to be involved with them.

secondaryrefs.comment: the boy with an evil spirit

children.title: Demons lead people away from God
The inspiration of pagan religions by demons
Pagan gods are identified as demons
Demons inhabit ruins of pagan cities
All involvement with spirits and mediums is forbidden
Witchcraft is identified as a work of the sinful nature
Involvement with sorcery or witchcraft is futile
Examples of renunciation of the work of demons
demons, possession by
children.comment: A recognised condition in Jesus Christ's lifetime in which an individual is dominated by the influence of a demon. In his ministry, Jesus Christ encountered and delivered many people in such a condition. Many of Christ's critics unsuccessfully sought to ascribe his authority and powers to demonic possession.

children.title: Unfounded accusations of demon-possession against Jesus Christ are refuted
Jesus Christ encounters cases of multiple demon-possession and is able to deliver
Further evidence of the possibility of multiple demon-possession
Demons recognise divine authority and their own limited powers
Jesus Christ's disciples have power to release from demon-possession by calling on Jesus' name
demons, exorcism of
children.comment: Jesus Christ drove out many demons during his earthly ministry and he delegated this authority to his disciples.

children.title: Jesus Christ understood exorcism as part of his ministry
He drove out demons from individuals brought to him
He drove out demons from individuals whom he encountered
Jesus Christ had power over demons
He was able to drive demons out at a distance
He used words of rebuke to drive out demons
Jesus Christ identifies the spiritual resources needed for exorcising demons
The ministry of exorcism was an indication of the kingdom's presence
The results of being delivered from demon-possession
The impact of exorcism on those who observe it
demons, Jesus Christ's authority over
children.comment: Demons are subject to the authority of Jesus Christ during his ministry and subsequently in the ministry of the church.

children.title: All spiritual powers are subject to Jesus Christ who has supreme authority
Demons are powerless before Jesus Christ
Demons can only do what he permits
The name of Jesus Christ has power against demons
Jesus Christ's name is used by his disciples
Jesus Christ anticipates the misuse of his own name

seealsos.comment: an example where Jesus' name is used in cases of demon-possession--but not by Jesus Christ's disciples, and not successfully

children.title: Jesus Christ's disciples have delegated power over demons
In the ongoing ministry of the church

angel of the Lord
children.comment: A title given to those angelic servants of God who are given specific tasks in furthering God's purposes among humanity. These tasks include the giving of revelations, guidance, encouragement, warnings and the execution of judgment on those who oppose God's purposes.

cschildren.title: The status of the angel of the Lord

children.title: He is identified with the Lord

primaryrefs.comment: The angel of the LORD here speaks for God and is recognised as God and as a messenger from God. This may indicate that the angel speaks on God's behalf (compare with the role of the prophets) or, as some believe, this may be a manifestation of the pre-incarnate Jesus Christ.

children.title: He is distinguished from the Lord

cschildren.title: The angel of the Lord is active in various ways

children.title: He has physical contact with people
He appears in supernatural form, often evoking fear
He appears in dreams and visions

cschildren.title: Functions of the angel of the Lord

children.title: He reveals information, often about forthcoming births
He affirms promises and gives blessing
He leads, delivers and protects Israel

cschildren.title: The archangel associated with the second coming
The archangel Gabriel

children.title: Gabriel as an interpreter of visions
Gabriel as a messenger of God

cschildren.title: The archangel Michael

children.title: Michael depicted as a warrior and protector
Associated with the death of Moses
cherubim
children.comment: Winged, heavenly creatures represented in the tabernacle and the temple.

cschildren.title: Description of the cherubim
Cherubim represented in the tabernacle and the temple

children.title: Cherubim at the entrance to the inner sanctuary
Cherubim over the ark of the covenant

cschildren.title: Cherubim represented in Ezekiel's vision of the temple
Cherubim represent the place of God's throne
Cherubim as guardians
Cherubim as God's chariot
Cherubim as agents of judgment

secondaryrefs.comment: the living creatures release the four horsemen of God's judgment on earth

children.title: divination
children.comment: Attempts to discover the unknown or the future by supernatural means, involving communication with the spirit world.  It is expressly forbidden by God and has disastrous consequences.

cschildren.title: Divination was part of early beliefs and practices
Examples of divination in NT times
The reality of a supernatural spirit world

children.title: The spirit world is real and alluring
The spirit world is powerful and dangerous

cschildren.title: Deliberate involvement with divination forbidden
It is God's divine privilege to reveal or conceal things
Examples of the evil of divination
Casting lots to make decisions
cschildren.precomment: Divination is clearly forbidden but some practices such as casting lots seem acceptable ways of discovering God's will in particular circumstances:

cschildren.title: Driving out demons

children.title: Jesus Christ accused of using satanic power to drive out demons
Jesus Christ commissioned his disciples to drive out demons
The failure of the disciples to drive out demons
Others attempted to use Jesus Christ's authority
Driving out demons is no substitute for obedience to the will of God
Driving out demons and Satan as an aspect of Jesus Christ's overall ministry

cschildren.title: Driving out people

children.title: exorcism
children.comment: The expulsion of an evil spirit or spirits from a person. Jesus Christ has unique authority as an exorcist. He delegated this authority to the disciples.

cschildren.title: Exorcism was practised with varying degrees of success by Jews and pagans
Jesus Christ had unique authority as an exorcist

primaryrefs.comment: The authority Jesus Christ exercised over evil spirits demonstrated that God's kingly authority was present in him.

seealsos.comment: Jesus Christ is the ``strong man''. His power over evil spirits shows that Satan is defeated.

cschildren.title: Jesus Christ had a general ministry of exorcism
Jesus Christ gave the apostles power to cast out evil spirits
After the ascension the apostles cast out evil spirits
Various symptoms associated with the need for exorcism
Various components of exorcism

children.title: The demons recognise the source of the authority addressing them
Exorcism was often accompanied by an element of violence or trauma
Exorcism changes the behaviour or condition of the person delivered

cschildren.title: Methods of exorcism other than the word of command

children.title: Exorcism may be achieved at a distance
On rare occasions an object is used

secondaryrefs.comment: This was an unusual demonstration of power in a city noted for magic.

children.title: David's music brought relief to Saul

cschildren.title: God's angelic attendants
The stars in the sky

children.title: mediums
children.comment: People who claim to be channels through whom the spirits of the dead speak to the living.

cschildren.title: God's people must not be mediums
God's people must not consult mediums
Examples of those who turned to mediums

children.title: seraphim
children.comment: An order of angels, mentioned only in one OT passage. Seraphim (the plural is also rendered seraphs) have a physical appearance and a moral and spiritual nature; they understand and use speech. Their functions include the worship of God and the communication of the assurance of forgiveness.

cschildren.title: Their appearance

primaryrefs.comment: The covering of faces and feet expresses reverence, humility and awe before God.

cschildren.title: Their functions

children.title: sorcery and magic
children.comment: The attempt to discover or influence the future by means forbidden by God, including the use of divination, astrology or witchcraft. Such practices are strongly condemned in Scripture.

cschildren.title: Examples of magic and sorcery

primaryrefs.comment: Babylon, here, represents the world as the centre of seduction.

cschildren.title: Examples of those who practised sorcery
All sorcery and magic is strongly forbidden
God is stronger than sorcerers and magicians
God's judgment comes upon sorcerers and magicians

children.title: God made participation in occult practices punishable by death
King Saul was judged for occult practices

cschildren.title: Jesus Christ can deliver from occultism

children.title: spiritism
children.comment: The use of mediums or other spiritual intermediaries to communicate with the dead. Scripture forbids such practices, which are inconsistent with obedience to a living God.

cschildren.title: Spiritism forbidden by God
Punishment for spiritism
Spiritism practised in Israel
Spiritists expelled from Israel
The futility of spiritism

children.title: spirits
children.comment: Intelligent beings which exist separately from bodies. God is spirit and he has given human beings a spiritual entity. He has also created a realm of spiritual beings--some have remained good, others have become evil. Evil spirits seek to control and destroy people, but Jesus Christ has the victory over them.

cschildren.title: God is spirit
Other spirits
The role of spirits

children.title: As instruments of testing to inspire faith in believers

cschildren.title: Evil spirits and humanity
Discernment and testing of spirits
Jesus Christ has supremacy over all created spirits
